channel.title: Mitb, i need your help!
channel.description:
Hey, Guys. My computer has been weird along time and i havent done anything on it then suddently, now it cant use any programs only internet and firefox, all programs doesnt respond... i have scanned my computer it has NONE virus!! im thinking of buying a new. but i thought i would see if u could see anything wrong.. i dont know if this helps. If u do know anything that can help you in figuring out please, tell me!
CPU Use : Switches From 40-1
SideFileUsing _____________ ( Dead )
And then under all this it says
( All In Use )
Handles 6114
Strings 347
Process 27
Alooked Memory ( K )
All = 226340 ( Switches To 400000 ) Keeps Flashin
Limit = 1280212
Top = 228300
Physical Memory
All = 523760
( Available to Use = 264320 )
System Cache = 332188
Core-Memory
All = 66448
Side-Shared ( I Dont Know IF Thats Correct )
53444
Non-Side-Shared : 12984
is there anything un-ordinary here.. im rly not good to this...
EDIT : Uhmm, and sometimes it stop running then shuts down and says it cant find Hard Disk, and the files C:/Windows/rs50vcfg.sys is damaged..

maybe you need more ram? dunno really just a suggestion.

item.title: Mitb, i need your help!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

They’re just the run of the machine, Ram, Hard Drive, Operating System Version, etc. You can find all of that when you click the System icon on Control Panel, if you could take a picture of it, and upload the picture with http://www.imageshack.us that’d be great, and to take a picture, press prnt scrn, it’s the button up to the right of f12. After that, open paint, and paste the picture onto the document, and save it as a file you can remember. like specs.png.

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb, i need your help!
item.dc:creator: @Eclipse940 Eclipse940
item.description:
@Eclipse940 wrote:

im sorry, but im kinda newb to this but ehh. Where do i find " specs "??

Read full topic

item.title: Mitb, i need your help!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I would say you’ve got some Faulty Hardware there, that’s not my professional opinion, I can’t accurately judge this, but until I know some of the specs on your computer, I can’t really say, if you’ve done a clean install of Windows Xp/Vista, then it’s definitely a hardware issue. I would recommend, if you haven’t just Formatted your Hard drive from Windows. Then Do a clean install with the Install CD, if you got your computer from HP or Dell, then I know you should have one. Unless you have the Backup Drive, then I would borrow someones Install CD, and use it.

After all of that, and you’re still having issues, post your computers Specs. And I can talk to you about it a little more. and then I can determine what the faulty device is.

Read full topic
